page.title: 05TWO HEADCORN BUSINESSES
page.content: Being in the centre of an agricultural region it is hardly surprising that the most noticeable business in the village is{Foreman's Agricultural {Merchants.}It is actually in the centre of the High Street. It is an old-established (1870) family run business supplying seeds,fertilizers and agricultural chemicals to the surrounding area. The company employs 55 people and has 8 lorries engaged in distribution. There are some branches elsewhere in Kent and also in Sussex. Another company with a depot in the High Street is{Woodcock's Haulage. This is on the opposite side of the High Street. 35 people are employed here and 24 lorries operate carrying almost any commodity,except bulk liquids. Lorries operate 24 hours a day and 7 days a week. Again this is a family business of long standing.
